planet.name: Kepler-37 b
KOI-245 b
KIC 8478994 b
UGA-1785 b
planet.description: Kepler-37 b is a tiny planet, about the size of our Moon. Due to the high irradiation it has probably a rocky surface with no atmosphere or water, similar than Mercury. NASA has given the planetary system the alternative identifier UGA-1785 in honor of the University of Georgia.

planet.name: Kepler-37 c
KOI-245 c
KIC 8478994 c
UGA-1785 c
planet.description: Kepler-37 is a three planet system discovered by Kepler. The planet Kepler-37 c is about three quaters the size of Earth. NASA has given the planetary system the alternative identifier UGA-1785 in honor of the University of Georgia.

planet.name: Kepler-37 d
KOI-245 d
KIC 8478994 d
UGA-1785 d
planet.description: Kepler-37 d is the outermost planet in a three planet system discovered by Kepler. It is twice as big as Earth and therefore the largest known planet in the system. NASA has given the planetary system the alternative identifier UGA-1785 in honor of the University of Georgia.
